description: Use BUT to explicitly state negative conditions and constraints. When system prevents an action, validates a boundary, or enforces a rule, use BUT to state what does NOT happen. Example: WHEN invalid input THEN error AND returns message BUT does not save data.

do.description: Add BUT clause to show what system prevents or does not do. Makes constraints explicit.

guidance.description: Use BUT to show what the system prevents
example: WHEN SubEpic creates Sub-Epic that has Stories children
THEN SubEpic identifies SubEpic already contains Stories
AND returns error indicating cannot create SubEpic under SubEpic with Stories

guidance.description: Use BUT to show what does not happen in error cases
Use BUT to clarify collection separation
example: THEN Story adds Scenario to common scenario child collection
BUT Story does not add Scenario to acceptance criteria child collection

guidance.description: Use BUT to show boundary enforcement
example: WHEN User drags node over incompatible parent
BUT does not allow drop operation

dont.description: Don't leave negative conditions implicit. Example: Don't say 'returns error' without stating what the system does NOT do

guidance.description: Don't omit the constraint being enforced
example: WHEN SubEpic creates Sub-Epic that has Stories
THEN SubEpic identifies SubEpic already contains Stories

guidance.description: Don't leave side effects unclear in error cases

example: THEN Story adds Scenario to scenario collection
